climbs.name: Yes I'm a long Way from Home

content.description: start left of the dihedral between upper and lower Earth buttresses climb a prominent crack system. Climb over the first roof on the left and the second roof on the right and head for the top.
content.location: rappel or downclimb to base of Earth buttress

content.description: Climb up to the spacious ledge 15' up on the left side. Climb up the deep chimney and off-width crack system, then straight up the white blocky face to bolted anchors.
content.location: downclimb or rappel to base of Earth Buttress

content.description: climb straight up the large, deep crack system on gray, yellow, and orange rock below the huge roof, then climb through the slot in middle of the roof.

Start up a short 2' right-facing corner to the ledge 15' up, pass the protruding thumb on the left or right, then climb up cracks and blocky face to the left of the big roof and head for the bolted anchors.

Climb straight up a narrow finger crack about two feet right of Theatre of Tragedy, then up the face to the right of several short roofs. Pull through the middle of the roof on sidepulls then up the steep face above. Variation: start about 6' right of Theatre of Tragedy at a hand crack on white rock and merge with the first route higher up.

Climb anywhere up the big blocky dihedral between the main and lower Earth buttress and head up to the cave. Go left or right of cave to top of lower Earth buttress. Named for a message that Governor Hogan flashed on highway message boards throughout the state at the height of the pandemic... and because of the abundant loose rock here.

Start at far left side of the ledge just right of the deep corner. Climb the face on horizontal cracks and use the flake if needed. Climb over center or left of the bulge 25 feet up and stay to the left to top of buttress.

Start on a small ledge at the base on yellow rock and climb straight up about 6' left of the deep right facing corner. Climb just right of the bulge 25' up and follow the buttress to the top. Use tree anchors to the left of the bolts or a directional anchor below the bolts.

Start at the small ledge 5' right of Pandemonium and climb straight up gray rock, staying just left of the deep right facing corner. Climb the top of the buttress to tree anchors or use the bolts with a directional anchor below.
content.location: Downclimb or rappel to base of Earth buttress.

content.description: Climb the prominent blocky buttress to the right of Disintegration and left of Chewy's Chimney- many variations are possible.
content.location: rappel down from lower Earth buttress or downclimb Chewy's Chimney.

content.description: start at the big chimney on the left side of lower Earth buttress and right of the dihedral. Climb cracks and ledges to top of buttress and then head left to top. Multiple variations are possible- you can spend all day exploring the variations.
content.location: rappel down from lower earth buttress

content.description: Start at the big ledge halfway up Chewy's Chimney. Climb the blocky arete to your left to the top of Lower Earth buttress. Climbed and named for my first grandchild the day after I got the news she was a girl.
Start at a wide crack to the right of Jenga Me Crazy and follow it up and slightly left to a blocky roof. Climb over the roof and follow the buttress to the top.
content.location: downclimb or rappel to the base of Earth buttress

content.description: Climb up a nice hand crack to the right end of the spacious ledge 15' up, then head straight up cracks and blocky face to the bolted anchor.
content.location: rappel to base of Earth buttress

content.description: Third buttress north of Moonshine buttress.
